body:
Hi @jedahan, thanks for the issue. This is happening because the `--ext` CLI option is no longer [supported](https://eslint.org/docs/latest/use/configure/migration-guide#cli-flag-changes) when linting with `eslint.config.js` (flat config format).

When you have an `eslint.config.js` in the root of your project, the flat config system is enabled. If you want to opt-out use the `ESLINT_USE_FLAT_CONFIG ` environment variable and set it `false`.

I don't have an `eslint.config.js` in the root of my project - it is in a directory above my project (outside of git, for example). I think that is the bug, I hope it makes sense. Thank you for the workaround.

The minimal example repo is an exception because i didn't know how best to structure it, like with submodules or something else.

```
mkdir new-project
cd new-project
git init
npm init --yes
npx tsc --init
npx eslint --init
echo 'export const greeting = (name: string) => console.log(`hello, ${name}`)' > greeting.ts
npx eslint --ext .ts
touch ../eslint.config.js
npx eslint --ext .ts
```

>  don't have an eslint.config.js in the root of my project 

Oh ok, sorry, I misunderstood.

Thanks for the example. ESLint will search the next parent directory for a config file if it can't find one in the `cwd` ([docs](https://eslint.org/docs/latest/use/configure/configuration-files-new#configuration-file-resolution)). So, in this case, ESLint finds `../eslint.config.js` and reports `--ext` usage as error, since it's no longer supported in flat config mode.

I believe this is what is happening in the example. @nzakas @mdjermanovic can you please verify if my assumption on this is correct here?
Exactly - in this case I do have a .eslintrc.js in the current directory, and it still looks in the parent directories.
@jedahan Please create a minimal repro using Stackblitz or create a GitHub repo and we will look into it.
The above repo is a minimal reproduction, as is the list of commands for how I created it

Are you referring to https://github.com/jedahan/c? That repo is empty.

As the issue template states, we need a repro that is on Stackblitz, the playground, or a Git repo to investigate.
My apologies @nzakas and everyone else who has been trying to help - i forgot to git push. It should be up.

Thanks, I'm able to reproduce.

Here's what's happening: We search for `eslint.config.js` *first*, and that search starts from the current working directory and continues up the directory structure. Because we're doing that first, we find the `eslint.config.js` file and ignore the `.eslintrc` file in the current working directory. If we didn't find `eslint.config.js`, then we'd search for, and find, `.eslintrc`.

We do it this way because the eslintrc logic is a lot more complicated and so it's not easy to extract the search for `.eslintrc` from the code in which it's buried. It's simple to look for `eslint.config.js` first and then revert to the eslintrc behavior later if necessary.

So in this case, the easiest way to fix the problem is to either remove or rename the `eslint.config.js` file. Another option would be set an environment variable `ESLINT_USE_FLAT_CONFIG=false`, which forces ESLint to skip the search for `eslint.config.js`.

In the short-term, we can probably add an additional error message that lets people know that some options aren't available when using flat config.
